Directed graphs
In this chapter we describe some functionality for directed graphs.
A directed graph E=(E^0,E^1,r,s) consists of a set of vertices E^0 and a set of edges E^1 together with functions s, r: E^1 \to E^0, called the source and range, respectively.

digraph1 = digraph2
= (for directed graphs) returns true if digraph1 and digraph2 have the same vertices, range, and source, and false if they do not.
